context: I failed to show appreciation for your hard work
letters:
Dear Dad,

I hope this note finds you well. I’ve been doing a lot of thinking lately, and there’s something important I need to express. I want to sincerely apologize for not showing you the appreciation you truly deserve for all the hard work you've put in for our family. 

I recognize how tirelessly you’ve labored, often sacrificing your own comforts to ensure that we have everything we need. I’m sorry for the times I took your efforts for granted, failing to acknowledge the countless sacrifices you made. It was wrong of me to overlook just how much you do for us.

You have always been my role model, and I admire your dedication and resilience. I wish I had communicated my gratitude more often because your hard work has not gone unnoticed, even if my words didn’t reflect that. I appreciate you more than words can express and I regret not letting you know sooner.

Moving forward, I want to be better at recognizing your contributions and expressing my gratitude. Thank you for your unwavering love and support, even when I falter.

With all my love,

[Your Name]
